lesson.title: Prepare Your Partner Teams for Launch
lesson.summary: We are getting closer to the launch date!  Now we need to bring in the teams that work more closely with our customers and users.

files.name: PMND C4 Training Guide For Sales And Customer Support Template

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A01 Lesson Intro V2
Where we are in the course
atoms.caption: Where We Are in the Course

atoms.title: Lesson intro
atoms.text:
In this lesson we will cover:  
- The partner teams we need to connect with before launch
- Why it is so important to connect with these teams
- Creating collateral for Sales and Customer Support Team
- Writing a user guide for our product

atoms.title: Additional Teams we need to work with Heading
atoms.text: ## Additional Teams We Need to Work With

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A02 Additional Teams We Need To Work With
Additional Teams we need to work with
atoms.caption: Teams PM works with

atoms.title: Additional Teams we need to work with Recap
atoms.text:
### New Terms

**Release notes**: These are notes or documents that will accompany your launch and describe new features or bugs that were fixed. Apple App Store for example, requires Releases notes which contain all the new features coming to your latest release.   
**Sales**: The Sales team is responsible for selling your product.   
**Customer Support**: Customer support team is the team that takes care of all customer complaints.   
**Technical Writers** Technical writers are responsible for writing all  of the documentation in the company. In some cases, they help with UI copy as well.  
**Product Specialists**: The Product Specialist role varies based on the company and product. In some cases they work closely with sales and customers with large accounts. In other cases they act as a bridge between Product and support teams.  



  
### Things to Remember About the Additional Teams We Need to Work With

As we get closer to launch we need to work with the teams that are closer to the users  
- Sales
- Customer support
- Technicals Writers
- Product Specialists

#### How is it different for different types of products?


There will be different workflows if you work on different types of products:
- Consumer: you will probably work closely with Customer Support, maybe with Technical Writers if there is a help center for your product. 

- Enterprise Product : you might work with all different teams, including Sales, Technical Writers, Customer Support.  It all depends on your product and the structure of your company 


#### How to work with different teams? 
- Create collaterals and documentation
-  You must work closely with them because they own the communication channels with your users
- Your role is to empower these teams to be successful by providing them information about the product


#### What if there are none of these functions in your startup?
 
Then it is probably ***your*** responsibility as the Product Manager to handle these items.

atoms.title: Exercise: What Do We Need?
atoms.text:
## Collateral Materials for the Party App  

We are getting closer to the launch of our Party App.  It is time to figure out which other teams we need to work with and what collateral materials they need to support our launch.     
   
Remember that we have two types of users for our app:  party organizers and vendors.   
  

Also remember that we are a well-supported  startup with fully staffed engineering, marketing, sales, legal, testing and customer support teams.

atoms.title: What do we need?
tasks: Determine which partner teams we need to work with (remember, we need help for both types of users)
Figure out what type of collateral materials we need to create for each team
atoms.positive_feedback: Nice work!  You can see my solution in the next video.
atoms.description: Get the partner teams that are closer to our users ready for launch

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A03 Solution- What Do We Need-
Solution: What Do We Need?
atoms.text:
### My Solution

#### Partner Teams We Need to Work With

- Sales Team for outreach to sign the vendors up for our platform  
- Technical Writer to write our release notes for the App Store  
- Customer Support to help with user questions and issues

#### Collateral Materials  We Need to Create
- Guidance for Sales on how to sell our product
- Help center information and articles
- Guidance for the Customer Support team

atoms.title: Further Research Sales and Support
atoms.text:
## Additional Reading  

Learn more about working with Sales and CS here:


- [Product managers and sales: The alliance that leads to a better product](https://www.appcues.com/blog/product-managers-and-sales-the-alliance-that-leads-to-a-better-product)  
- [How Product Management Can Work Effectively with Sales](https://community.uservoice.com/blog/how-to-work-effectively-with-sales/)
- [Why Support Should Have a Voice in Product Development](https://www.kayako.com/blog/product-development/)  
- [The Intersection of Product Management and Customer Success](https://strikedeck.com/the-intersection-of-product-management-and-customer-success/)

atoms.title: Working with Sales & CS
atoms.text: ## Working with Sales and Customer Support Teams

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A04 Atom Summary And Big Picture
Working with Sales & CS - big picture
atoms.text:
### Things to Remember About Working With Sales and Customer Support  

- Smaller companies might not have as many defined teams and processes so the PM may have wider responsibilities    
- Give the Sales and Customer Support teams enough time to get approvals, prepare communications and do the necessary training.  
- Inform the Sales and Customer Support teams every time you add features to your product so they are prepared to sell and support the new feature   
- Think about tools that you may need to build so that the support team can help and debug issues for users

question.prompt: True or False: The PM has sole responsibility for the launch process

answers.text: True
False

question.prompt: What are some good ways that you can build strong partnerships with the Customer Support team?

answers.text: Share your PRDs
After sharing the PRDs and mocks, let the support team build help content on their own
Shadow the support team and listen to how the team resolves customer issues over the phone
Ask the support team to present the top user facing issues from their perspective on a regular basis

question.prompt: What are some ways that you can build strong partnerships with the Sales team?

answers.text: Share your PRDs
Build the exact features the Sales team is asking for, as described by their clients
Schedule meetings with all the sales team members you will be working with to introduce yourself, making an effort to have these meetings on their time zone schedule

atoms.title: Sales and Customer support Heading
atoms.text: ## Sales and Customer Support Collateral Materials

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A05 Pre Launch Checklist- Sales And Customer Support
Sales and Customer support Recap
atoms.text:
### New Terms

**Minimum Viable Product (MVP) ** An early version of a product with only the features necessary to meet the needs of early adopters. It is used to get feedback for future development.


#### What to Include in Collateral Materials for Sales Team
- Our value proposition 
- How our product solves the user's problem 
- Our product vs. competitor's products

#### What to Include in Collateral Materials for Customer Support Team  
- Product overview
- Potential issues for users and work arounds
- Current vs. future product
- Known bugs




**Work with your partner teams to make sure they have all the information they need**

question.title: Think Like a Product Manager
question.text:
Think about your favorite product. Why do you like it more than a competitive product? 
Now imagine, you are a PM for that product. What would you tell the Sales team? What would you share with the Customer Support team?

answer.text:
One of my favorite enterprise products is the Atlassian Suite of products (Jira, Confluence, etc).
Jira is a product management tool that helps manage sprints and all the details around product management. 

In order for my CS team to be able to help our users, I would need to make sure the CS team is aware of all the features (like how to create an epic or log a bug or how to manage a sprint). There are training videos in the product, these are great and very helpful. I would work with the CS team to create more of these videos and guides to major flows.

For the Sales team: I would work with sales to outline the biggest pluses of our product. These are being able to manage all your product development in one place, an easy way for the managers to see what is done and a great way for product managers being able to get their job done. We would outline a value proposition along these lines.

atoms.title: Examples header
atoms.text: ## Example: Working with Sales and Customer Support

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A06 Pre Launch Checklist- Sales And Customer Support Example
Sales and Customer support Example Summary
atoms.text:
### Things to Remember About Working with Sales and Support

- You can learn a lot about your product by sitting next to support and listening to in on their calls with our customers

- The Sales Team can help you understand customer needs better by sharing what they hear from customers  and potential customers  

**Important! Your role is to understand and solve the underlying problem.**    
The solution the customers are asking for might not be the best solution for the problem they are having.

atoms.title: Sales and Customer support Problem Set

question.prompt: What should you include in your Customer Support guide?

answers.text: Potential issues that users might have with the product and how to resolve them
A description of the problem our product solves for users
List of all code names or internal project names
Description of how you developed your product
Value proposition of our product
Roadmap of all future features

atoms.title: Sales and Customer support Problem Set

question.prompt: What should you include in your Sales Guide?

answers.text: Value proposition of our product
A description of the problem our product solves for users
How our product compares to our competitor's product
How we came up with the UX for our product

question.title: Outline the steps you would take to make sure the team is ready to handle this issue with our users
question.text: You discover a new issue with the product: our app doesn't send party invites by text correctly. Which teams need to know about this problem?  What should you tell them?

answer.text:
The first team you should talk to is your engineering team to understand the timeline for the fix and if there is a way to work around the issue. 
Once you have all the details, you should update your Customer Support team and let them know how to handle the issue. 
Since this issue is pretty important, we should add an article in our help center that outlines that we will fix this issue soon

atoms.title: Exercise: Sales & Support
atoms.text:
##   Preparing Sale and Customer Support for the Party App Launch  

We want to make sure that our Sales and Customer Support teams are ready for our launch.  We need to create collateral materials to help them.     

Remember:  
- Our Sales team will be mostly working with vendors to bring them to our platform.     
- Our Customer Support Team will be working with both vendors and the party organizers who use our app. 
  
You can create your own guides or you can use this template: [Training Guide for Sales and Customer Support Template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Oz3bUkciqJ4AiPk8Y6cNT_kuFoGDQQoGX0wBYRalmD0/copy)  
   
You can also find a copy of the template in the **Resources** section of the Classroom

atoms.title: Exercise: Sales & Support
tasks: Write a Training Guide for your Sales team
Write a Support Guide for your Customer Support team
atoms.positive_feedback: Nice work!  You can see my solution in the next video
atoms.description: Create guides for the Sales and  Customer Support teams.

files.name: PMND C4 Party App Training Guide For Sales And Customer Support

atoms.title: Solution Header
atoms.text: ## Sales and Support Guide Solution

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A07 Solution- Sales & Support
Solution: Sales & Support
atoms.text:
## My Solution  

Your guides may be different.  This is what I would put in mine:   

### Sales Guide  
- **Section 1: Our platform** 
  - What does
  - Why we think it is great 
  - Value it provides for the vendors   

- **Section 2: Revenue sharing**  
  - Explain how revenue share will work on our platform

- **Section 3: How to use**
  - Explain how easy it is to use our platform


### Customer Support Guide   

#### For Vendors:
- **Section 1: Onboarding** 
   - How to become a vendor on our app  

- **Section 2: Features** 
  - What users can do on our app
  - How to use it  


#### For Party Organizers:

- **Section 1: App Features** 
  - What users can do on our app
  - How to use it  
- **Section 2: Bugs or issues** 
  -  Issues that Customer Support will need to be aware of to help our users   


**It is also a good idea to share your PRDs with Sales and Customer Support teams**

--- 

That's my solution.  What did your Sales and Customer Support Guides look like?

atoms.title: Further Research: Sales and Support Guides
User Guide Heading
atoms.text: ## User Guides

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A08 User Guide
User Guide Recap
atoms.text:
### Things to Remember About Communicating With Users

- There are a lot of tools on the market today to create a help center or support center.  
- Users want to be able to express their opinions and provide feedback.

atoms.title: User Guide  Recap part 2
atoms.text: **Remember that you are building your product for your users**.

question.prompt: How will we handle bugs we discover that affect users? *(Hint:  There is more than one correct response)*

answers.text: Write a support article about the bug
Donâ€™t do anything until Engineering fixes the issue
Notify your Customer Support team and share a solution for the problem
Provide Customer Support with a timeline for a solution
Tweet out an update with the exact time when the issue will be resolved

question.prompt: Select all of the items you should include in the user guide

answers.text: The main user flows
The research you did to develop your product
Known issues

atoms.title: Further Research
atoms.text:
### Additional Reading   

Learn more about knowledge base and support centers here: 

- [11 Platforms to Create Knowledge Base and FAQ for Your Business](https://geekflare.com/create-kb-faq-tools/)  
- [Zendesk](https://www.zendesk.com/support/)

atoms.title: User Guide Example Prep
atoms.text: ## Example: User Guide

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A09 User Guide Example
User Guide Example Summary
atoms.text:
### My Experience We were launching a totally new product so it had to be very well documented. - We shared our PRD with the Technical Writers team to make sure they understand the product and its details.
- We also shared: - Main flows - Known issues - Issues that would not be solved before launch - Specific scenarios about how to use the product

atoms.title: User Guide Graphic
atoms.caption: PM's Need to Share Detailed Product Information With Technical Writers

atoms.title: Exercise: User Guide
atoms.text:
## Exercise:  Write a User Guide   

As we get ready to launch our Party App, we need to create documentation for our users.  Let's start writing a User Guide for our party organizer users.
  

You can create your own guides or you can use this template: User [GuideTemplate](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rNiZX4E-Pdry4E2_BpkHuf_KVR6ST3k3XAlvKWhlnds/copy).

You can also find a copy of the template in the Resources section of the Classroom.

atoms.title: Exercise: User Guide
tasks: Make a list of the tasks a user would perform when using the Party App
Choose two tasks and write step-by-step instructions to guide the user through completing each task
Choose a feature of the app and write a guide to help the user find and use that feature
atoms.positive_feedback: Great! You can see my solution in the next video.
atoms.description: Start writing a User Guide for the Party App

files.name: PMND C4 Party App User Guide

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A10 Solution- User Guide
Solution: User Guide
atoms.text:
### My Solution

There are a lot of different things a party organizer can with with our app, but I am going to focus on these two scenarios:  

1.  Signing up for our product  
2.  Organizing a party

And then we will outline these flows in detail, including screenshots.

Since our product will connect users to vendors it might require payments. We will show our users where to find their payment methods.

What scenarios did you focus on in your User Guide?  What feature did you highlight?

atoms.title: User Guide Further Research
atoms.text:
### Enrichment Activity
Analyze the help pages of your favorite product.   
- What do you like about the pages?
- What don't you don't like? 
- How easy is it to find a solution for a problem with the product?

## Additional Reading  

Learn more about writing a user guide here:  

- [How to Create a User Instruction Manual](https://www.userfocus.co.uk/articles/usermanuals.html)
- [Tips for Writing User Manuals](https://stepshot.net/how-to-create-a-user-instruction-manual/)

atoms.title: ND036 C4 L03 A11 Lesson Recap V2
Lesson Recap
atoms.text:
### Before We Move On...

- Sales is the voice of the customer

- Customer Support can be a great resource   

- Monitor the support tickets

- If you have technical writers, use them!  

-  Use all the help you can get!  

### You should not be creating your product in a vacuum  

Listen to people, get their feedback, show that you care what they think. You will achieve more through  collaboration than on your own.

atoms.title: Recap image
atoms.caption: What We Learned in This Lesson
atoms.alt: What we learned in Next Steps for Launch

atoms.title: Glossary
atoms.text:
## New Terms in This Lesson

| Term | Definition | |------|:--------------| | Customer Support | Customer support team is the team that takes care of all customer complaints | | Minimum Viable Product (MVP) | An early version of a product with only the features necessary to meet the needs of early adopters | | Product Specialists | The team that takes care of customers with big accounts or acts as a bridge between Customer Support and the Product Manager | | Release notes | These are notes or documents that will accompany your launch. Apple App Store for example, requires Releases notes which contain all the new features coming to your latest release | | Sales | The Sales team is responsible for selling your product | | Technical Writers | Technical writers are responsible for writing all of the documentation in the company. In some cases, they help with UI copy as well |
